required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of Single Rising and Multiple Oral Doses of Telmisartan / Hydrochlorothiazide (HCTZ) in Healthy Male Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of Single Rising Oral Doses (40 mg Telmisartan / 12.5 mg HCTZ to 80 mg Telmisartan / 12.5 mg HCTZ) and Multiple Oral Doses (80 mg Telmisartan / 12.5 mg HCTZ) of Drug in Healthy Male Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock:
Group 1:
To investigate safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetics of Telmisartan + HCTZ (T40/H12.5 and T80/H12.5)
Group 2:
To investigate safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetics of Telmisartan + HCTZ (T80/H12.5 x 7 days)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with clinically relevant findings in physical examination
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 10 days after last drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with clinically relevant findings in vital signs
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 10 days after last drug administration
primary_outcome.description: blood pressure, pulse rate, body temperature

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with clinically relevant findings in 12-lead ECG
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 10 days after last drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with clinically relevant findings in clinical laboratory tests
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 10 days after last drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 10 days after last drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Global assessment of tolerability by the investigator
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 10 days after last drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum concentration of the analytes in plasma (Cmax)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 96 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the concentration time curve of the analytes in plasma (AUC)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 96 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Time from dosing to maximum concentration of the analytes in plasma (tmax)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 96 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Terminal rate constant of the analytes in plasma (λz)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 96 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Terminal half-life of the analytes in plasma (t1/2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 96 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean residence time of the analytes in the body after po administration (MRTpo)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 96 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Apparent clearance of the analytes in the plasma after extravascular administration (CL/F)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 96 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Apparent volume of distribution of the analytes in plasma during the terminal phase λz following an extravascular dose (Vz/F)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 96 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Amount of HCTZ that is eliminated in urine from the time interval t1 to t2 (Aet1-t2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Fraction of HCTZ excreted unchanged in urine from time point t1 to t2 (fet1-t2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Renal clearance of HCTZ in plasma from the time point t1 until the time point t2 (CLR, t1-t2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Minimum measured concentration of the analytes in plasma at steady state over a uniform dosing interval τ (Cmin,ss)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 96 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Average concentration of the analytes in plasma at steady state (Cavg)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 96 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Accumulation ratio of the analytes in plasma after multiple dose administration over a uniform dosing interval τ (RA)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 96 hours after drug administration

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy males according to the following criteria: No finding deviating of clinical relevance and no evidence of a clinically relevant concomitant disease based upon a complete medical history, including the physical examination, vital signs (blood pressure (BP), pulse rate (PR), body temperature), 12-lead ECG, clinical laboratory tests
- Age ≥20 and Age ≤35 years
- Body Mass Index (BMI) ≥17.6 and BMI ≤26.4 kg/m2
- Signed and dated written informed consent prior to admission to the study in accordance with "Good Clinical Practice (GCP)"
Exclusion Criteria:
- Gastrointestinal, hepatic, renal, respiratory, cardiovascular, metabolic, immunological or hormonal disorders
- Diseases of the central nervous system (such as epilepsy) or psychiatric disorders or neurological disorders
- Chronic or relevant acute infections
- Any laboratory value outside the reference range that is of clinical relevance
- Positive result for hepatitis B surface (HBs) antigen, anti hepatitis C virus (HCV) antibodies, Syphilitic test or HIV test
- Surgery of gastrointestinal tract (except appendectomy)
- History of relevant orthostatic hypotension (mean standing SBP varies by ≥ 20 mmHg from mean supine systolic blood pressure (SBP) and/or mean standing diastolic blood pressure (DBP) varies by ≥ 10 mmHg from mean supine DBP), fainting spells or blackouts.
- History of hepatic dysfunction (e.g. biliary cirrhosis, cholestasis)
- History of serious renal dysfunction
- History of bilateral renal artery stenosis or renal artery stenosis in a solitary kidney
- History of cerebrovascular disorder
- History of hyperkalemia
- Known hypersensitivity to any component of the formulation; known hypersensitivity to any other angiotensin II receptor antagonist; known hypersensitivity to sulfonamides or sulphonamide-derived drugs (e.g. thiazides)
- History of impaired glucose tolerance
- History of hypokalemia
- History of hyperuricemia
- Salt restriction therapy
- Intake of drugs with a long half-life (> 24 hours) within at least one month or less than 10 half-lives of the respective drug prior to administration or during the trial
- Use of drugs which might reasonably influence the results of the trial based on the knowledge at the time of protocol preparation within 7 days prior to administration or during the trial
- Participation in another trial with an investigational drug within four months or 6 half-lives of the investigational drug, whichever is longer, prior to administration or during the trial
- Smoker (more than 20 cigarettes /day)
- Alcohol abuse
- Drug abuse
- Blood donation (more than 100 mL within four weeks prior to administration or during the trial)
- Excessive physical activities (within seven days prior to administration)
- Intake of alcohol within two days prior to administration
- Inability to comply with dietary regimen of study centre
- Inability to comply with smoking cessation during hospitalization
